GOD.content: is Levinas’ face god or human? unable to differentiate infinite alterity of God from that of human > Levinas & Kierkegaard can’t find limit btwn religious & ethical
GOD.linkedContent: is Levinas’ face god or human? unable to differentiate infinite alterity of God from that of human > Levinas & Kierkegaard can’t find limit btwn religious & ethical

R.content: Levinas placed responsibility before and above “difficult freedom”

MONL.content: alone in a genre [particular] that becomes a universal example, exemplarity of host as hostage: “universal hostage”
MONL.linkedContent: alone in a genre [particular] that becomes a universal example, exemplarity of host as hostage: “universal hostage”

MONL.content: other is entirely other when knowledge and recognition does not suffice for it
MONL.linkedContent: other is entirely other when knowledge and recognition does not suffice for it

FL.content: Levinas speaks of infinite right, “Jewish humanism,” disproportion of justice, holiness (sainteté), but Derrida moves away in the context of FL
FL.linkedContent: Levinas speaks of infinite right, “Jewish humanism,” disproportion of justice, holiness (sainteté), but Derrida moves away in the context of FL

H.content: p. anne 98 Levinas: “essence of language is friendship and hospitality”
subject as a host and a hostage
H.linkedContent: subject as a host and a hostage

VM.content: Levinas makes us tremble, from the heart of the desert, a thought which makes us dream of dispossession and dismantling: depart from Greek site, perhaps every site
VM.linkedContent: Levinas makes us tremble, from the heart of the desert, a thought which makes us dream of dispossession and dismantling: depart from Greek site, perhaps every site

VM.content: Levinas’ metaphysics and ethics support themselves, do not flow into other streams at their source (nonviolent, infinitely Other)
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ metaphysics and ethics support themselves, do not flow into other streams at their source (nonviolent, infinitely Other)

VM.content: Levinas shelters, in spite of his best efforts, most decisive moments of his discourse in metaphor [his writing style merits a study itself]
VM.linkedContent: Levinas shelters, in spite of his best efforts, most decisive moments of his discourse in metaphor [his writing style merits a study itself]

VM.content: Levinas’ “false infinity” an infinity which cannot overflow the same, Plato and Descartes only 2 thinkers w/ infinity [in line] w/ Levinas’
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ “false infinity” an infinity which cannot overflow the same, Plato and Descartes only 2 thinkers w/ infinity [in line] w/ Levinas’

VM.content: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object
VM.linkedContent: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object

VM.content: Levinas’ method risks accusing theoretism, that which separates, of not separating
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ method risks accusing theoretism, that which separates, of not separating

VM.content: Levinas seeks a second parricide, to murder the Greek father (who still holds us in his sway), a father Plato could only hallucinate murdering, “a hallucination within the hallucination that is already speech” > could a non-Greek succeed in doing what a Greek could never do? and do so by feigning to speak Greek, can one feign to speak a language?
VM.linkedContent: Levinas seeks a second parricide, to murder the Greek father (who still holds us in his sway), a father Plato could only hallucinate murdering, “a hallucination within the hallucination that is already speech” > could a non-Greek succeed in doing what a Greek could never do? and do so by feigning to speak Greek, can one feign to speak a language?

VM.content: for Levinas, Platonic gesture beyond being ineffectual unless multiplicity and alterity understood as absolute solitude of existent in his existence
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, Platonic gesture beyond being ineffectual unless multiplicity and alterity understood as absolute solitude of existent in his existence

VM.content: [Derrida on Levinas’ method] uses philosophy’s own light to reveal that philosophy’s surface is severely cracked (lézardes), that its solidity is its rigidity > progresses along cracks, negates negations, neither/nor, poetic force of metaphor a trace of this wounding of language
VM.linkedContent: [Derrida on Levinas’ method] uses philosophy’s own light to reveal that philosophy’s surface is severely cracked (lézardes), that its solidity is its rigidity > progresses along cracks, negates negations, neither/nor, poetic force of metaphor a trace of this wounding of language

VM.content: for Levinas, classical dissymmetry of same and other feigns overturning while remaining the same, impassive beneath an algebraic substitution
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, classical dissymmetry of same and other feigns overturning while remaining the same, impassive beneath an algebraic substitution

VM.content: for Levinas, concrete (nonformal) tautology or false (finite) heterology [compare to “false infinite”], along w/ the negative (work, history, etc.), never has a relation w/ other > no negativity in metaphysical transcendence
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, concrete (nonformal) tautology or false (finite) heterology [compare to “false infinite”], along w/ the negative (work, history, etc.), never has a relation w/ other > no negativity in metaphysical transcendence

VM.content: w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant
VM.linkedContent: w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant

VM.content: Derrida stresses that one will not be able to follow Levinas [in Totality and Infinity] if one is not convinced by equation ego = same, or by idea that rebellion against same is purely intelligible
VM.linkedContent: Derrida stresses that one will not be able to follow Levinas [in Totality and Infinity] if one is not convinced by equation ego = same, or by idea that rebellion against same is purely intelligible

VM.content: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being

VM.content: Levinas: ontology as first philosophy is philosophy of power [anti-Nietzschean?]
VM.linkedContent: Levinas: ontology as first philosophy is philosophy of power [anti-Nietzschean?]

VM.content: Levinas drags all classical concepts into agora, they’re summoned to justify themselves in ethico-political language they didn’t always seek, must confess their violent aims

VM.content: caught btwn Husserl & Heidegger, Levinas always [?] criticizes the one in language of the other
VM.linkedContent: caught btwn Husserl & Heidegger, Levinas always [?] criticizes the one in language of the other

VM.content: for Levinas, ethics, morality, is first philosophy; though Plato and Descartes thought the overflowing of infinity, only Levinas thought infinity as the face
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, ethics, morality, is first philosophy; though Plato and Descartes thought the overflowing of infinity, only Levinas thought infinity as the face

VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, writing must be secondary to living, original speech, w/out it there could be grammar/lexicon w/out language > cybernetics, electronics

VM.content: speech of God distinguishes Levinas from Socrates in Phaedrus
VM.linkedContent: speech of God distinguishes Levinas from Socrates in Phaedrus

VM.content: Levinas’ infinitism is pre-Kantian, Levinas’ reading of Descartes’ 3rd Meditation supports entirety of his thought: absolute irreducibility of other, infinitely Other can only be infinity
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ infinitism is pre-Kantian, Levinas’ reading of Descartes’ 3rd Meditation supports entirety of his thought: absolute irreducibility of other, infinitely Other can only be infinity

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Husserl misunderstands Descartes’ 3rd Meditation, places infinite entirely w/in subjectivity, makes it an object, so phenomenology cannot account for ethics
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Husserl misunderstands Descartes’ 3rd Meditation, places infinite entirely w/in subjectivity, makes it an object, so phenomenology cannot account for ethics

VM.content: for Levinas, asymmetry, non-light, commandment are violence and injustice only in relation to finite things, Levinas’ infinite God avoids a world of pure/worst violence, of immorality itself, by being infinite, does not rage war of single, naked finite man
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, asymmetry, non-light, commandment are violence and injustice only in relation to finite things, Levinas’ infinite God avoids a world of pure/worst violence, of immorality itself, by being infinite, does not rage war of single, naked finite man

VM.content: for Levinas, totality is always finite totality
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, totality is always finite totality

VM.content: Levinas breaks w/ Parmenides, Spinoza and Hegel w/ presence as separation, “the idea of creation ex nihilo”
VM.linkedContent: Levinas breaks w/ Parmenides, Spinoza and Hegel w/ presence as separation, “the idea of creation ex nihilo”

VM.content: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Hegel and Kierkegaard: violent & pre-metaphysical egoisms
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Hegel and Kierkegaard: violent & pre-metaphysical egoisms

VM.content: Levinas must pose question of closure, “question of the relations between belonging and the opening,” to break w/ phenomenology and ontology
VM.linkedContent: Levinas must pose question of closure, “question of the relations between belonging and the opening,” to break w/ phenomenology and ontology

VM.content: Levinas must pose a kind of unheard of graphics, w/in which philosophical conceptuality would be no more than a function
VM.linkedContent: Levinas must pose a kind of unheard of graphics, w/in which philosophical conceptuality would be no more than a function

VM.content: Levinas has affinities w/ Feuerbach in latter’s anti-Hegelianism and in relation to the trace
VM.linkedContent: Levinas has affinities w/ Feuerbach in latter’s anti-Hegelianism and in relation to the trace

VM.content: Levinas concerned w/ essence of ethical, not laws or moral rules; wouldn’t ethics beyond law be the Law of Laws—infinite concept, hidden in protest against concept [see FWT p. 132]?
VM.linkedContent: Levinas concerned w/ essence of ethical, not laws or moral rules; wouldn’t ethics beyond law be the Law of Laws—infinite concept, hidden in protest against concept [see FWT p. 132]?

VM.content: why must Levinas obliterate notion of spatiality re: the other, w/out erasing it, w/out making it illegible? > must he state infinity’s excess in language of the Same [inside-outside]?
VM.linkedContent: why must Levinas obliterate notion of spatiality re: the other, w/out erasing it, w/out making it illegible? > must he state infinity’s excess in language of the Same [inside-outside]?

VM.content: [does Levinas try to preserve positive infinity alongside spatiality of face? should he name finite what he names infinitely other if it must pass through space, negation?]
VM.linkedContent: [does Levinas try to preserve positive infinity alongside spatiality of face? should he name finite what he names infinitely other if it must pass through space, negation?]

VM.content: Levinas gave up his best weapon: disdain of discourse (negative theology), does not give himself the right to speak in language resigned to its own failure
VM.linkedContent: Levinas gave up his best weapon: disdain of discourse (negative theology), does not give himself the right to speak in language resigned to its own failure

VM.content: negative theology knew itself failed and finite, inferior to logos, to God’s understanding, never sought God face to face
VM.linkedContent: negative theology knew itself failed and finite, inferior to logos, to God’s understanding, never sought God face to face

VM.content: how Levinas differs from negative theology > possibility of metaphysics is possibility of speech, metaphysical responsibility is responsibility for language, “thought consists in speaking”
VM.linkedContent: how Levinas differs from negative theology > possibility of metaphysics is possibility of speech, metaphysical responsibility is responsibility for language, “thought consists in speaking”

VM.content: if speech, which must maintain absolute separation, is rooted in space (in Same) (which cannot conceive separation and absolute alterity) > discourse is originally violent and a logos of peace becomes an inaccessible horizon
VM.linkedContent: if speech, which must maintain absolute separation, is rooted in space (in Same) (which cannot conceive separation and absolute alterity) > discourse is originally violent and a logos of peace becomes an inaccessible horizon

VM.content: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]
VM.linkedContent: metaphysics unable to escape its ancestry in light, always supposes phenomenology in its critique of phenomenology [re: Levinas]

VM.content: for Levinas, if Husserlian Cogito opened to infinite, it would be an object-infinity w/out alterity, a “false infinity” [Levinas never uses this Hegelian term, but idea of indefinite, negative form of infinity haunts his gestures]; Levinas makes true alterity nonnegativity, and the same (complicit w/ negativity) the false-infinity > would have seemed absolutely mad to Hegel

VM.content: wasn’t it Husserl who showed us that vision, perception were inadequate, the infinite overflowing of horizons? did he really reduce this inadequation to condition of available objects?
VM.linkedContent: wasn’t it Husserl who showed us that vision, perception were inadequate, the infinite overflowing of horizons? did he really reduce this inadequation to condition of available objects?

VM.content: Levinas deprives himself of the foundations of his own language
VM.linkedContent: Levinas deprives himself of the foundations of his own language

VM.content: Levinas’ ethics not  (yet) practical?
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ ethics not (yet) practical?

VM.content: is it risky of Levinas to think of Being as dominated by theme of unveiling when Heidegger continually affirms concealment?
VM.linkedContent: is it risky of Levinas to think of Being as dominated by theme of unveiling when Heidegger continually affirms concealment?

VM.content: Levinas seeks to oppose God to sacred divine, for God to be indicated in Space of Sacred, in light of deity > limit and wellspring (ressource) of finite-being as history: limit because God’s not there and wellspring because anticipation of thought of Being toujours voit venir Dieu
VM.linkedContent: Levinas seeks to oppose God to sacred divine, for God to be indicated in Space of Sacred, in light of deity > limit and wellspring (ressource) of finite-being as history: limit because God’s not there and wellspring because anticipation of thought of Being toujours voit venir Dieu

VM.content: Levinas proposes an ethics w/out law and a language w/out phrase
VM.linkedContent: Levinas proposes an ethics w/out law and a language w/out phrase

VM.content: Levinas renews empiricism, revealing it to itself as metaphysics, he even says, “the radical empiricism confident in the instruction of exteriority”
VM.linkedContent: Levinas renews empiricism, revealing it to itself as metaphysics, he even says, “the radical empiricism confident in the instruction of exteriority”

ATIA.content: Levinas: best way to see the other is to not notice the color of his eyes [Derrida points out Levinas is speaking about man]
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas: best way to see the other is to not notice the color of his eyes [Derrida points out Levinas is speaking about man]

ATIA.content: Levinas has never inscribed trace of an-other as animal (far as I know)
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas has never inscribed trace of an-other as animal (far as I know)

ATIA.content: despite all his ruptures, Levinas in no way interrupts the axis of human subject re: animal sacrifice, gives animal no capacity for the face-to-face
ATIA.linkedContent: despite all his ruptures, Levinas in no way interrupts the axis of human subject re: animal sacrifice, gives animal no capacity for the face-to-face

ATIA.content: list of Levinas’ ruptures, obsessions, and also the fact that the face remains fraternal
ATIA.linkedContent: list of Levinas’ ruptures, obsessions, and also the fact that the face remains fraternal

ATIA.content: Levinas reconfigures Descartes’ infinite will to “I am (following) after the infinite” > subject as host/hostage of the infinite
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas reconfigures Descartes’ infinite will to “I am (following) after the infinite” > subject as host/hostage of the infinite

ATIA.content: Levinas’ nudity doesn’t concern itself w/ sexual difference, w/ animal
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas’ nudity doesn’t concern itself w/ sexual difference, w/ animal

ATIA.content: if Levinas doesn’t know if the animal has a face, doesn’t this call into question the whole discourse/ethics of the face?
ATIA.linkedContent: if Levinas doesn’t know if the animal has a face, doesn’t this call into question the whole discourse/ethics of the face?

ATIA.content: something in Levinas closed off to future he “barely” opens up, i.e. his “no” to animal’s face
ATIA.linkedContent: something in Levinas closed off to future he “barely” opens up, i.e. his “no” to animal’s face

ATIA.content: for Levinas, “thou shalt not kill” is the 1st commandment to come from face of the other > refers only to the face, don’t murder the face, my neighbor, my brother, another human
ATIA.linkedContent: for Levinas, “thou shalt not kill” is the 1st commandment to come from face of the other > refers only to the face, don’t murder the face, my neighbor, my brother, another human

ATIA.content: responsibility of one who says “here I am” is Levinas’ first inspiration for his “first philosophy”; it is autodeictic, autobiographical: 1) exposing oneself before the law 2) ability to respond to an appeal or command of the other
ATIA.linkedContent: responsibility of one who says “here I am” is Levinas’ first inspiration for his “first philosophy”; it is autodeictic, autobiographical: 1) exposing oneself before the law 2) ability to respond to an appeal or command of the other

ATIA.content: death, for Levinas, the moment the other no longer responds (different from animal nonresponse)
ATIA.linkedContent: death, for Levinas, the moment the other no longer responds (different from animal nonresponse)

ATIA.content: [Derrida on limitations of Levinas’ thinking around dog Bobby]
ATIA.linkedContent: [Derrida on limitations of Levinas’ thinking around dog Bobby]

ATIA.content: Levinas’ Bobby dog is a witness for us, an other w/out alterity: recalls the subject to being subject > this is not sufficient deconstruction of Cartesian man/animal borderline
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas’ Bobby dog is a witness for us, an other w/out alterity: recalls the subject to being subject > this is not sufficient deconstruction of Cartesian man/animal borderline

FS.linkedContent: [Levinas’] face as structuralist repose [?], peacefulness of a spectacle, horizon

DIF.content: Levinas’ trace, enigma of absolute alterity (a past never present), solicits domination of beings (w/in these limits, differance implies Levinas’ entire critique of classical ontology)
DIF.linkedContent: Levinas’ trace, enigma of absolute alterity (a past never present), solicits domination of beings (w/in these limits, differance implies Levinas’ entire critique of classical ontology)

DPi.content: for Levinas, peace is the ethical itself

ATM.content: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night
ATM.linkedContent: “he will have obligated (il aura obligé),” a phrase knotted up (se noue) in a certain way of tying (lier), a serial structure of a singular type > edges of the sentence in fog, belong to the night

ATM.content: to neither pay homage to, nor “rendez-vous” w/ Levinas, a gesture beyond any possible restitution, operating w/out debt: absolute ingratitude, Derrida would pay homage to Levinas’ radical generosity, which requires, “ingratitude de l’autre”
ATM.linkedContent: to neither pay homage to, nor “rendez-vous” w/ Levinas, a gesture beyond any possible restitution, operating w/out debt: absolute ingratitude, Derrida would pay homage to Levinas’ radical generosity, which requires, “ingratitude de l’autre”

ATM.content: passage beyond language requires language, or requires text as a place for the trace of a step (pas) that passes beyond language, not (present) elsewhere [not classical]
ATM.linkedContent: passage beyond language requires language, or requires text as a place for the trace of a step (pas) that passes beyond language, not (present) elsewhere [not classical]

ATM.content: Levinas negotiates his negotiation w/ the unnegotiable in a way where he negotiates the negotiation (he reties the thread, weaves his interruptions of the same), to give the other a chance [Derrida refers to a double negation here], reprend dans sa toile l’histoire de toutes ses ruptures
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas negotiates his negotiation w/ the unnegotiable in a way where he negotiates the negotiation (he reties the thread, weaves his interruptions of the same), to give the other a chance [Derrida refers to a double negation here], reprend dans sa toile l’histoire de toutes ses ruptures

ATM.content: no tear (déchirure) possible in Levinas’ text w/out a certain notching (échancrure) of the 2nd moment, and certain contamination btwn the 2 > he likes the tear he detests contamination
ATM.linkedContent: no tear (déchirure) possible in Levinas’ text w/out a certain notching (échancrure) of the 2nd moment, and certain contamination btwn the 2 > he likes the tear he detests contamination

ATM.content: “metaphors” of seam and tear (couture et déchirure) obsess Levinas’ texts
ATM.linkedContent: “metaphors” of seam and tear (couture et déchirure) obsess Levinas’ texts

ATM.content: for Levinas, interruption puts an end to the authority of the Said, the thematical, dialectical, the same, the economical
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, interruption puts an end to the authority of the Said, the thematical, dialectical, the same, the economical

ATM.content: Levinas describes how the enveloping continuum or tissue of the State, the dialectic, etc., preserves itself by cutting out interruptions and retying/maintaining itself in suppressing them: Levinas reties cut threads (not continuous ones): this is the trace of his diachrony, trace of discontinuity
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas describes how the enveloping continuum or tissue of the State, the dialectic, etc., preserves itself by cutting out interruptions and retying/maintaining itself in suppressing them: Levinas reties cut threads (not continuous ones): this is the trace of his diachrony, trace of discontinuity

ATM.content: since the State reties knots around interruptions too, Levinas must be retying cut threads instead of continuous ones, though Derrida stresses these knots look the same
ATM.linkedContent: since the State reties knots around interruptions too, Levinas must be retying cut threads instead of continuous ones, though Derrida stresses these knots look the same

ATM.content: [Derrida wonders about the risk of Levinas’ obligated negotiation, what he calls an inevitable “concession”: to stricture interruptions, contaminate, interrupt them]
ATM.linkedContent: [Derrida wonders about the risk of Levinas’ obligated negotiation, what he calls an inevitable “concession”: to stricture interruptions, contaminate, interrupt them]

ATM.content: via Levinas, interruptions unbound “together,” in the “same” sériature, in dia-synchrony, a serial one time of “several times” that took place only once
ATM.linkedContent: via Levinas, interruptions unbound “together,” in the “same” sériature, in dia-synchrony, a serial one time of “several times” that took place only once

ATM.content: no edges in this interruptive series, in this incomparable stricture, but tapering points (establishing continuity at a distance [?]) > binding & unbinding, the lace (lacet) of obligation is in place (not a trap): an ob-ligation that un-binds, opens up religion in this very unbinding
ATM.linkedContent: no edges in this interruptive series, in this incomparable stricture, but tapering points (establishing continuity at a distance [?]) > binding & unbinding, the lace (lacet) of obligation is in place (not a trap): an ob-ligation that un-binds, opens up religion in this very unbinding

ATM.content: the taking place in another place of Levinas’s oeuvre is an extravagant topic, another thinking of the name, a thinking that is tout autre because open to the name of the other (u-topic only for those who believe they know ce qui a lieu et ce qui tient lieu)
ATM.linkedContent: the taking place in another place of Levinas’s oeuvre is an extravagant topic, another thinking of the name, a thinking that is tout autre because open to the name of the other (u-topic only for those who believe they know ce qui a lieu et ce qui tient lieu)

ATM.content: Levinas has not only withdrawn dissymmetrical responsibility from circle (of pact, debt, synchronic reciprocity, recognition) but also from annular alliance, from the rounds (tour)
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas has not only withdrawn dissymmetrical responsibility from circle (of pact, debt, synchronic reciprocity, recognition) but also from annular alliance, from the rounds (tour)

ATM.content: if Levinas insists on superimposing the trace, leaving a trace, entracing, how can we dissociate this trace from a sign?
ATM.linkedContent: if Levinas insists on superimposing the trace, leaving a trace, entracing, how can we dissociate this trace from a sign?

ATM.content: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”

ATM.content: Levinas’ intr(el)aced saying [dire entr(el)acé]
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas’ intr(el)aced saying [dire entr(el)acé]

ATM.content: the retrait Levinas re-marks is not unique, though it remarks the unique, its seriasure is unique > not his signature but his seriasure
ATM.linkedContent: the retrait Levinas re-marks is not unique, though it remarks the unique, its seriasure is unique > not his signature but his seriasure

ATM.content: [re: Levinas] by making sexual difference secondary, by excluding the feminine, does She figure “the wholly other of this Saying of the wholly other,” thus under-signing the undersigned of the work [He?], that is, countersigning, not as a redoubling of the signature—but autrement que signer
ATM.linkedContent: [re: Levinas] by making sexual difference secondary, by excluding the feminine, does She figure “the wholly other of this Saying of the wholly other,” thus under-signing the undersigned of the work [He?], that is, countersigning, not as a redoubling of the signature—but autrement que signer

ATM.content: sensitive to violence, Derrida reminds us that Levinas never erased the sexual mark of his signature, and referred to tout autre as feminine, this fault of Derrida’s, who does it wound?
ATM.linkedContent: sensitive to violence, Derrida reminds us that Levinas never erased the sexual mark of his signature, and referred to tout autre as feminine, this fault of Derrida’s, who does it wound?

AD.content: Levinas conscious of immense responsibility w/ modesty of prophet
AD.linkedContent: Levinas conscious of immense responsibility w/ modesty of prophet

AD.content: how Levinas upsets (dérange) the dialectical affiliation of subject/predicate
AD.linkedContent: how Levinas upsets (dérange) the dialectical affiliation of subject/predicate

AD.content: that decision & responsibility are always of the other, the making unconscious of the Schmittian sovereign decision (cf. POOF 68-9), not how Levinas would put it
AD.linkedContent: that decision & responsibility are always of the other, the making unconscious of the Schmittian sovereign decision (cf. POOF 68-9), not how Levinas would put it

AD.content: for Levinas, separation as “metaphysics,” an experience of hospitality, irruption of finite in infinite, the passage meta ta physika passes through hospitality of finite threshold that opens to infinity
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, separation as “metaphysics,” an experience of hospitality, irruption of finite in infinite, the passage meta ta physika passes through hospitality of finite threshold that opens to infinity

AD.content: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)
AD.linkedContent: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)

AD.content: [sweet Derrida] miracle of trace allows us to read Levinas and have meaning for us today
AD.linkedContent: [sweet Derrida] miracle of trace allows us to read Levinas and have meaning for us today

AD.content: very thrust (poussée) of Levinas’ thought: makes borderline (ligne de frontière), semantic identity of all the words he uses, tremble
AD.linkedContent: very thrust (poussée) of Levinas’ thought: makes borderline (ligne de frontière), semantic identity of all the words he uses, tremble

AD.content: given Levinas’ idea of paternal fecundity, he’s suspicious of psychoanalysis’ primal repression (for Levinas, it must be secondary)

AD.content: Levinas’ ContraDiction, intimate caesura but also respiration of saying > non-dialectizable justice

AD.content: Levinas trying to delimit a faith in election safe from (à l’abri de) all “nationalist” temptation
